   19: %%
   20: 
   21: -module(shell_docs_SUITE).
   22: -moduledoc false.
   23: 
   24: -export([all/0, suite/0, groups/0, init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   25:    init_per_group/2, end_per_group/2, init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   26: 
   27: -export([render/1, links/1, normalize/1, render_prop/1,render_non_native/1, ansi/1, columns/1]).
   28: -export([render_function/1, render_type/1, render_callback/1]).
   29: 
   30: -export([render_all/1, update_render/0, update_render/1]).
   31: 
   32: -export([execute/3]).
   33: 
   34: -include_lib("kernel/include/eep48.hrl").
   35: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   36: 
   37: suite() ->
   38:     [{timetrap,{minutes,30}}].
   39: 
   40: all() ->
   41:     [ {group, render},
   42:       {group, prop},
   43:       {group, render_smoke},
   44:       ansi, columns
   45:     ].
   46: 
   47: 
   48: groups() ->
   49:     [ {prop,[],[render_prop]},
   50:       {render, [], [render, render_non_native, links, normalize]},
   51:       {render_smoke, [], [render_function, render_type, render_callback]}
   52:     ].
   53: 
   54: %% Include a spec here in order to test that specs of undocumented functions
   55: %% is rendered correctly.
   56: -spec init_per_suite(Config1) -> Config2 when
   57:       Config1 :: list({atom(),term()}),
   58:       Config2 :: list({atom(),term()}).
   59: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   60:     {ok, ?MODULE} = c:c(?MODULE,[debug_info]),
   61:     Config.
   62: 
   63: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   64:     ok.
   65: 
   66: init_per_group(prop, Config) ->
   67:     ct_property_test:init_per_suite(Config);
   68: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   69:     Config.
   70: 
   71: end_per_group(_GroupName, _Config) ->
   72:     ok.
   73: 
   74: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
   75:     Env = [{App, Key, application:get_env(App, Key)}
   76:            || {App, Key} <- [{kernel, shell_docs_ansi},
   77:                              {stdlib, shell_docs_columns}]],
   78:     [{env, Env} | Config].
   79: 
   80: end_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
   81:     lists:foreach(
   82:       fun({App, Key, undefined}) ->
   83:               application:unset_env(App, Key);
   84:          ({App, Key, {ok, Val}}) ->
   85:               application:set_env(App, Key, Val)
   86:       end,
   87:       proplists:get_value(env, Config)).
   88: 
   89: %% We keep the docs of a couple of complex modules
   90: %% in the data_dir in order to compare then with the original
   91: %% when we fix bugs so that we don't break anything.
   92: %%
   93: %% This testcase is always run so that we do now forget to
   94: %% check that any bugfix does not break the current behaviour.
   95: %%
   96: %% If you do a bugfix that does not break this testcase when
   97: %% fixed you should include that module in the list of modules
   98: %% tested.
   99: %%
  100: %% Currently the modules are:
  101: -define(RENDER_MODULES, [sofs, re, file, erlang, user_drv, ?MODULE]).
  102: %% If you need to update the definition because this
  103: %% testcase fails, just run update_render/0,1.
  104: render(Config) ->
  105: 
  106:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  107: 
  108:     lists:foreach(
  109:       fun(Module) ->
  110:               {ok, [D]} = file:consult(filename:join(DataDir, atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".docs_v1")),
  111:               maps:map(
  112:                 fun(FName, Current) ->
  113:                         case file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir,FName)) of
  114:                             {ok, Original} when Original =:= Current ->
  115:                                 ok;
  116:                             {ok, Original} ->
  117:                                 ct:log("Original: ~n~ts",[Original]),
  118:                                 ct:log("Current : ~n~ts",[Current]),
  119:                                 ct:fail(output_changed);
  120:                             {error, enoent} ->
  121:                                 %% All modules are not available on all
  122:                                 %% platforms. For instance socket is not
  123:                                 %% available on windows.
  124:                                 ok
  125:                         end
  126:                 end, render_module(Module, D))
  127:       end, ?RENDER_MODULES).
  128: 
  129: update_render() ->
  130:     update_render(
  131:       filename:join([os:getenv("ERL_TOP"),
  132:                      "lib", "stdlib", "test", "shell_docs_SUITE_data"])).
  133: update_render(DataDir) ->
  134:     lists:foreach(
  135:       fun(Module) ->
  136:               case code:get_doc(Module) of
  137:                   {ok, D} ->
  138:                       ok = file:write_file(
  139:                              filename:join(DataDir, atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".docs_v1"),
  140:                              io_lib:format("~w.",[D])),
  141:                       maps:map(
  142:                         fun(FName, Output) ->
  143:                                 ok = file:write_file(filename:join(DataDir, FName), Output)
  144:                         end, render_module(Module, D));
  145:                   E ->
  146:                       io:format("Error processing: ~p ~p",[Module, E])
  147:               end
  148:       end, ?RENDER_MODULES).
  149: 
  150: handle_error({error,_}) ->
  151:   ok;
  152: handle_error(Doc) ->
  153:   unicode:characters_to_binary(Doc).
  154: 
  155: only_if_smp(Func) ->
  156:     only_if_smp(4, Func).
  157: only_if_smp(Schedulers, Func) ->
  158:     case erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) of
  159:       N when N < Schedulers -> {skip,"Too few schedulers online"};
  160:       _ -> Func()
  161:     end.
  162: 
  163: %%
  164: %% Render function
  165: %%
  166: %% This function tests that OTP code base can print its documentation
  167: %% in the shell. It is a time consuming operation that can take
  168: %% up-to 40 - 50 min if run in a single processor (1 scheduler config) machine.
  169: %%
  170: %% Skip the test case when running in a machine with not enough SMP.
  171: %%
  172: %% OBS. render_type/render_callback have shorter times and do not need
  173: %%      to be skipped, regardless of the number of available schedulers.
  174: %% 
  175: render_function(_Config) ->
  176:   only_if_smp(fun render_function_do/0).
  177: 
  178: render_function_do() ->
  179:     docsmap(
  180:       fun(Mod, D) ->
  181:               DHTML = markdown_to_shelldoc(D),
  182:               Exports = try Mod:module_info(exports)
  183:                         catch _:undef -> []
  184:                         end, %% nif file not available on this platform
  185:               pmap(
  186:                 fun(Config) ->
  187:                         try
  188:                             handle_error(shell_docs:render(Mod, D, Config)),
  189:                             [try
  190:                                  handle_error(shell_docs:render(Mod, F, A, DHTML, Config))
  191:                              catch _E:R:ST ->
  192:                                      io:format("Failed to render ~p:~p/~p~n~p:~p~n~p~n",
  193:                                                [Mod,F,A,R,ST,shell_docs:get_doc(Mod,F,A)]),
  194:                                      erlang:raise(error,R,ST)
  195:                              end || {F,A} <- Exports]
  196:                         catch throw:R:ST ->
  197:                                 io:format("Failed to render ~p~n~p:~p~n",[Mod,R,ST]),
  198:                                 exit(R)
  199:                         end
  200:                 end, format_configurations())
  201:       end),
  202:     ok.
  203: 
  204: render_type(_Config) ->
  205:     docsmap(
  206:       fun(Mod, #docs_v1{ docs = Docs } = D) ->
  207:               DHTML = markdown_to_shelldoc(D),
  208:               pmap(
  209:                 fun(Config) ->
  210:                         try
  211:                           handle_error(shell_docs:render_type(Mod, D, Config)),
  212:                           [try
  213:                              handle_error(shell_docs:render_type(Mod, T, A, DHTML, Config))
  214:                            catch _E:R:ST ->
  215:                                io:format("Failed to render type ~p:~p/~p~n~p:~p~n~p~n",
  216:                                          [Mod,T,A,R,ST,shell_docs:get_type_doc(Mod,T,A)]),
  217:                                erlang:raise(error,R,ST)
  218:                            end || {{type,T,A},_,_,_,_} <- Docs]
  219:                         catch throw:R:ST ->
  220:                             io:format("Failed to render ~p~n~p:~p~n",[Mod,R,ST]),
  221:                             exit(R)
  222:                         end
  223:                 end, format_configurations())
  224:       end),
  225:   ok.
  226: 
  227: render_callback(_Config) ->
  228:     docsmap(
  229:       fun(Mod, #docs_v1{ docs = Docs } = D) ->
  230:               DHTML = markdown_to_shelldoc(D),
  231:               pmap(
  232:                 fun(Config) ->
  233:                         try
  234:                           handle_error(shell_docs:render_callback(Mod, D, Config)),
  235:                           [try
  236:                              handle_error(shell_docs:render_callback(Mod, T, A, DHTML, Config))
  237:                            catch _E:R:ST ->
  238:                                io:format("Failed to render callback ~p:~p/~p~n~p:~p~n~p~n",
  239:                                          [Mod,T,A,R,ST,shell_docs:get_callback_doc(Mod,T,A)]),
  240:                                erlang:raise(error,R,ST)
  241:                            end || {{callback,T,A},_,_,_,_} <- Docs]
  242:                         catch throw:R:ST ->
  243:                             io:format("Failed to render ~p~n~p:~p~n",[Mod,R,ST]),
  244:                             exit(R)
  245:                         end
  246:                 end, format_configurations())
  247:       end),
  248:     ok.
  249: 
  250: docsmap(Fun) ->
  251:   F = fun F({Mod,_,_}) ->
  252:             F(Mod);
  253:           F(Mod) when is_list(Mod) ->
  254:             F(list_to_atom(Mod));
  255:           F(Mod) ->
  256:             case code:get_doc(Mod) of
  257:               {error, missing} ->
  258:                 ok;
  259:               {error, cover_compiled} ->
  260:                 ok;
  261:               {error, E} when E =:= eperm; E =:= eacces; E =:= eio ->
  262:                 %% This can happen in BSD's for some reason...
  263:                 ok;
  264:               {error, eisdir} ->
  265:                 %% Uhm?
  266:                 ok;
  267:               {ok, Docs} ->
  268:                 try
  269:                   _ = Fun(Mod, Docs),
  270:                   {ok, self(), Mod}
  271:                 catch E:R:ST ->
  272:                     io:format("Failed to render ~p~n~p:~p:~p~n",[Mod,E,R,ST]),
  273:                     erlang:raise(E,R,ST)
  274:                 end
  275:             end
  276:       end,
  277:   lists:foreach(F, code:all_available()),
  278:   ok.
  279: 
  280: 
  281: format_configurations() ->
  282:   [#{},
  283:    #{ ansi => false },
  284:    #{ ansi => true },
  285:    #{ columns => 5 },
  286:    #{ columns => 150 },
  287:    #{ encoding => unicode },
  288:    #{ encoding => latin1 }].
  289: 
  290: markdown_to_shelldoc(#docs_v1{format = Format}=Docs) ->
  291:     DefaultFormat = <<"text/markdown">>,
  292:     DFormat = binary_to_list(DefaultFormat),
  293:     case Format of
  294:         _ when Format =:= DefaultFormat orelse Format =:= DFormat ->
  295:             ModuleDoc = Docs#docs_v1.module_doc,
  296:             Doc = Docs#docs_v1.docs,
  297:             Docs#docs_v1{format = ?NATIVE_FORMAT,
  298:                          module_doc = process_moduledoc(ModuleDoc),
  299:                          docs = process_doc_attr(Doc)};
  300:         _  ->
  301:             Docs
  302:     end.
  303: 
  304: -spec process_moduledoc(Doc :: map() | none | hidden) -> map() | none | hidden.
  305: process_moduledoc(Doc) when Doc =:= none orelse Doc =:= hidden ->
  306:     Doc;
  307: process_moduledoc(Doc) when is_map(Doc) ->
  308:     maps:map(fun (_K, V) -> shell_docs_markdown:parse_md(V) end, Doc).
  309: 
  310: process_doc_attr(Doc) ->
  311:     lists:map(fun process_doc/1, Doc).
  312: 
  313: process_doc(Docs) when is_list(Docs) ->
  314:     lists:map(fun process_doc/1, Docs);
  315: process_doc({_At, _A, _S, Doc, _M}=Entry) when Doc =:= none orelse Doc =:= hidden ->
  316:     Entry;
  317: process_doc({Attributes, Anno, Signature, Doc, Metadata}) ->
  318:     Docs = maps:map(fun (_K, V) -> shell_docs_markdown:parse_md(V) end, Doc),
  319:     {Attributes, Anno, Signature, Docs, Metadata}.
  320: 
  321: 
  322: render_prop(Config) ->
  323: %    dbg:tracer(),dbg:p(all,c),dbg:tpl(shell_docs_prop,[]),
  324:     ct_property_test:quickcheck(
  325:       shell_docs_prop:prop_render(),Config).
  326: 
  327: links(_Config) ->
  328:     docsmap(
  329:       fun(Mod, #docs_v1{ module_doc = MDoc, docs = Docs, format = ?NATIVE_FORMAT }) ->
  330:               try
  331:                   [check_links(Mod, maps:get(<<"en">>,MDoc)) || MDoc =/= none, MDoc =/= hidden]
  332:               catch _E1:R1:ST1 ->
  333:                       io:format("Failed to render ~p~n~p:~p~n~p~n",
  334:                                 [Mod,R1,ST1,MDoc]),
  335:                       erlang:raise(error,R1,ST1)
  336:               end,
  337:               [try
  338:                   check_links(Mod, D)
  339:                catch _E:R:ST ->
  340:                        io:format("Failed to render ~p:~p~n~p:~p~n~p~n",
  341:                                  [Mod,Kind,R,ST,D]),
  342:                        erlang:raise(error,R,ST)
  343:                end || {Kind,_Anno,_Sig,#{ <<"en">> := D },_MD} <- Docs];
  344:          (Mod, #docs_v1{ format = Fmt }) ->
  345:               io:format("Skipping ~p because format is ~ts~n",
  346:                         [Mod, Fmt])
  347:       end).
  348: 
  349: check_links(Mod, [{a,Attr,C}|T]) ->
  350:     case proplists:get_value(rel,Attr) of
  351:         <<"https://erlang.org/doc/link/seemfa">> ->
  352:             case string:lexemes(proplists:get_value(href, Attr),":#/") of
  353:                 [_App,TargetMod,Func,Arity] ->
  354:                     case code:get_doc(b2a(TargetMod)) of
  355:                         {ok, _ModDoc} ->
  356:                             case shell_docs:get_doc(b2a(TargetMod),
  357:                                                     b2a(Func),
  358:                                                     binary_to_integer(Arity)) of
  359:                                 [] -> throw({could_not_find,b2a(TargetMod),
  360:                                                 b2a(Func),
  361:                                                 binary_to_integer(Arity)});
  362:                                 _Else  -> ok
  363:                             end;
  364:                         _Else ->
  365:                             throw({could_not_find, TargetMod, Attr})
  366:                     end;
  367:                 _Callback ->
  368:                     ok
  369:             end;
  370:         _OtherlinkType ->
  371:             ok
  372:     end,
  373:     check_links(Mod, C),
  374:     check_links(Mod, T);
  375: check_links(Mod, [{_,_,C}|T]) ->
  376:     check_links(Mod, C),
  377:     check_links(Mod, T);
  378: check_links(Mod, [C|T]) when is_binary(C) ->
  379:     check_links(Mod, T);
  380: check_links(_, []) ->
  381:     ok.
  382: 
  383: normalize(_Config) ->
  384:     ?assertMatch(
  385:        [{p,[],[{em,[],[<<"a ">>,{code,[],[<<"b ">>]},<<"c">>]}]}],
  386:        shell_docs:normalize([{p,[],[{em,[],[<<" a ">>,{code,[],[<<" b  ">>]},<<" c">>]}]}])
  387:       ),
  388:     ?assertMatch(
  389:        [{'div',[],[<<"!">>]}],
  390:        shell_docs:normalize([{'div',[],[{code,[],[<<" ">>,{i,[],[<<" ">>]}]},<<" !">>]}])
  391:       ),
  392:     ok.
  393: 
  394: %% Special binary_to_atom that deals with <<"'and'">>
  395: b2a(Bin) ->
  396:     case erl_scan:string(binary_to_list(Bin)) of
  397:         {ok,[{atom,_,A}],_} -> A;
  398:         {ok,[{A,_}],_} -> A
  399:     end.
  400: 
  401: %% Test rendering of non-native modules
  402: render_non_native(_Config) ->
  403:     Docs = #docs_v1{
  404:         anno = erl_anno:new(13),
  405:         beam_language = not_erlang,
  406:         format = <<"text/asciidoc">>,
  407:         module_doc = #{<<"en">> => <<"This is\n\npure text">>},
  408:         docs = []
  409:     },
  410: 
  411:     <<"\n\tnot_an_erlang_module\n\n"
  412:       "    This is\n"
  413:       "    \n"
  414:       "    pure text\n">> =
  415:         unicode:characters_to_binary(
  416:           shell_docs:render(not_an_erlang_module, Docs, #{ ansi => false })),
  417: 
  418:     ok.
  419: 
  420: %% Testing functions
  421: render_all(Dir) ->
  422:     file:make_dir(Dir),
  423:     %% We load all possible application in order to be able to use
  424:     %% application:get_application to get the application a module
  425:     %% belongs to.
  426:     PossibleApplications =
  427:         lists:flatmap(
  428:           fun(P) ->
  429:                   filelib:wildcard(filename:join(P, "*.app"))
  430:           end, code:get_path()),
  431:     [application:load(list_to_atom(filename:basename(filename:rootname(App)))) ||
  432:         App <- PossibleApplications],
  433:     docsmap(fun(Mod, D) ->
  434:                     maps:map(
  435:                       fun(FName, Value) ->
  436:                               file:write_file(filename:join(Dir, FName), Value)
  437:                       end, render_module(Mod, D))
  438:             end).
  439: 
  440: render_module(Mod, #docs_v1{ docs = Docs } = D) ->
  441:     Opts = #{ ansi => true, columns => 80, encoding => unicode },
  442:     case application:get_application(Mod) of
  443:         {ok, App} ->
  444:             App;
  445:         _ ->
  446:             App = unknown
  447:     end,
  448:     SMod = atom_to_list(App) ++ "_" ++ atom_to_list(Mod),
  449:     Files =
  450:         #{
  451:           SMod ++ ".txt" =>
  452:               unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render(Mod, D, Opts)),
  453:           SMod ++ "_type.txt" =>
  454:               unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render_type(Mod, D, Opts)),
  455:           SMod ++ "_cb.txt" =>
  456:                     unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render_callback(Mod, D, Opts))
  457:          },
  458:     lists:foldl(
  459:       fun({_Type,_Anno,_Sig,none,_Meta}, Acc) ->
  460:               Acc;
  461:          ({{function,Name,Arity},_Anno,_Sig,_Doc,_Meta}, Acc) ->
  462:               FAName = SMod ++ "_"++atom_to_list(Name)++"_"++integer_to_list(Arity)++"_func.txt",
  463:               FName = SMod ++ "_"++atom_to_list(Name)++"_func.txt",
  464:               FADocs = unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render(Mod, Name, Arity, D, Opts)),
  465:               FDocs = unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render(Mod, Name, D, Opts)),
  466:               case string:equal(FADocs,FDocs) of
  467:                   true -> 
  468:                       Acc#{ sanitize(FAName) => FADocs };
  469:                   false ->
  470:                       Acc#{ sanitize(FAName) => FADocs,
  471:                             sanitize(FName) => FDocs}
  472:               end;
  473:          ({{type,Name,Arity},_Anno,_Sig,_Doc,_Meta}, Acc) ->
  474:               FName = SMod ++ "_"++atom_to_list(Name)++"_"++integer_to_list(Arity)++"_type.txt",
  475:               Acc#{ sanitize(FName) =>
  476:                         unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render_type(Mod, Name, Arity, D, Opts))};
  477:          ({{callback,Name,Arity},_Anno,_Sig,_Doc,_Meta}, Acc) ->
  478:               FName = SMod ++ "_"++atom_to_list(Name)++"_"++integer_to_list(Arity)++"_cb.txt",
  479:               Acc#{ sanitize(FName) =>
  480:                         unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render_callback(Mod, Name, Arity, D, Opts))}
  481:       end, Files, Docs).
  482: 
  483: sanitize(FName) ->
  484:     lists:foldl(
  485:       fun({Re,Replace}, Txt) ->
  486:               re:replace(Txt,Re,Replace,[global,{return,list}])
  487:       end, FName, [{"/","slash"},{":","colon"},
  488:                    {"\\*","star"},{"<","lt"},{">","gt"},{"=","eq"}]).
  489: 
  490: ansi(_Config) ->
  491:     {ok, Docs} = code:get_doc(?MODULE),
  492: 
  493:     HasESC =
  494:         fun(Config) ->
  495:                 Doc = shell_docs:render(?MODULE, Docs, Config),
  496:                 string:find(Doc, "\e") =/= nomatch
  497:         end,
  498: 
  499:     application:set_env(kernel, shell_docs_ansi, true),
  500:     ?assert(HasESC(#{})),
  501:     ?assertNot(HasESC(#{ansi => false})),
  502:     ?assert(HasESC(#{ansi => true})),
  503: 
  504:     application:set_env(kernel, shell_docs_ansi, false),
  505:     ?assertNot(HasESC(#{})),
  506:     ?assertNot(HasESC(#{ansi => false})),
  507:     ?assert(HasESC(#{ansi => true})),
  508: 
  509:     ok.
  510: 
  511: -doc """
  512: Doc doc doc doc doc doc doc doc doc doc doc doc doc doc doc.
  513: """.
  514: columns(_Config) ->
  515:     {ok, Docs} = code:get_doc(?MODULE),
  516: 
  517:     MaxColumns =
  518:         fun(Config0) ->
  519:                 Config = maps:merge(#{ansi => false}, Config0),
  520:                 Doc = shell_docs:render(?MODULE, ?FUNCTION_NAME, Docs, Config),
  521:                 Lines = string:split(Doc, "\n", all),
  522:                 lists:max(lists:map(fun string:length/1, Lines))
  523:         end,
  524: 
  525:     application:set_env(stdlib, shell_docs_columns, 30),
  526:     ?assert(MaxColumns(#{}) =< 30),
  527:     ?assert(MaxColumns(#{columns => 20}) =< 20),
  528: 
  529:     application:set_env(stdlib, shell_docs_columns, not_an_integer),
  530:     ?assert(MaxColumns(#{}) > 30),
  531: 
  532:     application:set_env(stdlib, shell_docs_columns, 0),
  533:     ?assert(MaxColumns(#{}) > 30),
  534: 
  535:     application:set_env(stdlib, shell_docs_columns, -30),
  536:     ?assert(MaxColumns(#{}) > 30),
  537: 
  538:     application:unset_env(stdlib, shell_docs_columns),
  539:     ?assert(MaxColumns(#{}) > 30),
  540:     ?assert(MaxColumns(#{columns => 20}) =< 20),
  541: 
  542:     ok.
  543: 
  544: %%
  545: %% Parallel map function.
  546: %%
  547: %% Parallel map function that discards the result of the function
  548: %% `F` applied to each of the items in `Ls`. It spawns as many
  549: %% processes as items there are in `Ls`. If the list is large,
  550: %% consider adding a set of working processes that round-robin on
  551: %% the job to do be done.
  552: %%
  553: %% - `F` is the function to perform
  554: %% - `Ls` the list of items to iterate on
  555: %%
  556: pmap(F, Ls) when is_function(F),
  557:                  is_list(Ls) ->
  558:   _ = lists:foreach(fun(Config) ->
  559:                         spawn_link(?MODULE, execute,[Config, F, self()])
  560:                    end, Ls),
  561:   ResponseCounter = length(Ls),
  562:   ok = sync(ResponseCounter),
  563:   ok.
  564: 
  565: execute(Item, F, Pid) ->
  566:   _ = F(Item),
  567:   Pid ! ok.
  568: 
  569: sync(0) ->
  570:   ok;
  571: sync(N) ->
  572:   receive
  573:     ok ->
  574:       sync(N-1)
  575:   end.
